title: Chicken Parmesan
tagline: Crispy cutlets, bubbling mozzarella. The key: don't bake it in sauce.
description: Crispy breaded cutlets, melted mozzarella, marinara. Not soggy. Serves 4.
steps: Preheat oven to broil. Line a baking sheet with foil.
Pound chicken to ¼" even thickness between plastic wrap. This ensures even cooking.
Set up breading station: flour in one dish, beaten eggs in second, panko mixed with parmesan, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and salt in third.
Dredge each cutlet: flour → egg → panko mixture. Press panko firmly to adhere.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high. Fry cutlets 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through (165°F). Work in batches.
Transfer cutlets to baking sheet. Spoon marinara around (not over) chicken—keep the breading exposed.
Top each cutlet with mozzarella slices.
Broil 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. Watch carefully.
Serve topped with fresh basil and extra sauce on the side.
notes: The soggy mistake: Most recipes bake chicken IN the sauce. This makes breading soggy. Sauce goes around, not on top.
Pound it thin: ¼" thickness cooks evenly and stays tender. Thick pieces overcook on outside.
Fresh mozzarella: Melts better than shredded, creates better texture.
Make it a sub: Slice and pile on hoagie roll with extra sauce and cheese.
Storage: Best fresh. Reheat on wire rack in 375°F oven to restore crispness.
